history.proof: intro H. split. - intro abs. apply not_in_cons in H. destruct H. auto. - intro abs. apply not_in_cons in H. destruct H. auto.

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
X: Type
y: X
x: X
A: list X

Goal:
~ x el y :: A -> x <> y /\ ~ x el A

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
not_in_cons : forall (A : Type) (x a : A) (l : list A), ~ x el a :: l < -> x <> a /\ ~ x el l
in_cons_neq : forall x y A, x el y :: A -> x <> y -> x el A
list_exists_not_incl : forall (X : eqType) (A B : list X), ~ A <<= B -> exists x : X, x el A /\ ~ x el B
in_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x el remove eq_dec y l -> x el l /\ x <> y
list_exists_DM : forall (X : Type) (A : list X) (p : X -> Prop), (forall x : X, dec (p x)) -> ~ (forall x : X, x el A -> ~ p x) -> exists x : X, x el A /\ p x
notin_flat_map_Forall : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (x : B) (l : list A), ~ x el flat_map f l < -> Forall (fun y : A => ~ x el f y) l
in_in_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x y : A), x <> y -> x el l -> x el remove eq_dec y l
notin_remove : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x : A), ~ x el l -> remove eq_dec x l = l
remove_In : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x : A), ~ x el remove eq_dec x l
nodup_inv : forall (A : Type) (decA : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (k l : list A) (a : A), nodup decA k = a :: l -> ~ a el l
count_occ_not_In : forall (A : Type) (eq_dec : forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) (l : list A) (x : A), ~ x el l < -> count_occ eq_dec l x = 0
ForallOrdPairs_In : forall (A : Type) (R : A -> A -> Prop) (l : list A), ForallOrdPairs R l -> forall x y : A, x el l -> y el l -> x = y \/ R x y \/ R y x
cfind : forall (A0 : list ?X) (p : ?X -> Prop), (forall x : ?X, dec (p x)) -> {x0 : ?X | x0 el A0 /\ p x0} + {forall x0 : ?X, x0 el A0 -> ~ p x0} where ?X : [X : Type x : X y : X A : list X |- Type]
in_flat_map : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> list B) (l : list A) (y : B), y el flat_map f l < -> (exists x : A, x el l /\ y el f x)
in_map_iff : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (y : B), y el map f l < -> (exists x : A, f x = y /\ x el l)
in_elt_inv : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), x el l1 ++ y :: l2 -> x = y \/ x el l1 ++ l2
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = [a] -> x = [] /\ y = [a] \/ x = [a] /\ y = []
in_concat : forall (A : Type) (l : list (list A)) (y : A), y el concat l < -> (exists x : list A, x el l /\ y el x)
NoDup_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), ~ x el l -> NoDup l -> NoDup (x :: l)
nodup : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> list A
remove : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> A -> list A -> list A
app_cons_not_nil : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), [] <> x ++ a :: y
count_occ : forall A : Type, (forall x y : A, {x = y} + {x <> y}) -> list A -> A -> nat
Relation_Operators.Ltl_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> list A -> SProp), (forall (a : A) (x : list A), P [] (a :: x)) -> (forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, P (a :: x) (b :: y)) -> (forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> P x y -> P (a :: x) (a :: y)) -> forall l l0 : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA l l0 -> P l l0
Relation_Operators.Ltl_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), (forall (a : A) (x : list A), P [] (a :: x)) -> (forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, P (a :: x) (b :: y)) -> (forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> P x y -> P (a :: x) (a :: y)) -> forall l l0 : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA l l0 -> P l l0

```coq
intro H. split.
- intro abs. apply not_in_cons in H. destruct H. auto.
- intro abs. apply not_in_cons in H. destruct H. auto.
Qed.
```
